intro: Astragalus isparticus, commonly known as the Isparta milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to Turkey. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Astragalus isparticus is of interest in botanical studies due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
